review_title: blush is pretty good, bronzer is way too light

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content:
Ive always wanted to try both the orgasm blush and the laguna bronzer, due to the huge hype they have. However, whenever i swatched them at the store i wasnt impressed, therefore couldnt bring myslef to purchase the full sizes. So when i saw this dou i thought it would be the perfect opportunity to give these a channce, because i know some makeup performs better than it swatches. Well, i was dissapointed. The blush color payoff is barely there; what you do get is glitter. The glitter is chunky and streaky, not good. The bronzer wouldnt show up! I tried several brushes and even my fingers but nothing could get this bronzer to work, either it wouldnt show or it would make my face seem muddy/dirty. I am fairly light so its not that the bronzer would be too light for me. Save your money, not worth the hype.

The bronzer blends beautifully and really looked natural but gave so much color. Also, the blush has a great amount of shimmer and kind of acted as a highlight as well! Love!

This is a great duo to try out both of the famous products. Unfortunately, the bronzer does not show up very well on my tan skin tone. The blush is okay, it's just not my cup of tea. I was very excited but will not be repurchasing.

After longingly looking at the NARS palettes and not wanting to pay a million dollars for a blush, I felt I got a bigger bang for my buck with this duo. You get a blush & bronzer for a great price. I'm not a makeup person (all my money goes to my skincare. I'd rather have amazing skin than cover what I could've prevented) but for the few events where I do wear makeup, I want to look great. I love the blush color. It looks great on my skin (medium/olive) and the Rose sparkle gives the perfect glow that I love. Pick this up if you want to just try it out.

Orgasm looks very nice with my light/neutral complexion and it looks peachy with a light shimmer on me. I found I had to build it using my blush brush for it to be seen at all. review_content:
I was so excited about this product. The colors look gorgeous, it's travel-sized, and it's NARS, which is usually a great brand. However, this blush/bronzer duo failed me. I can't get the colors to show up on me. I've tried different brushes to apply, just using my fingers, different foundations....Nothing works. I have extremely pale skin, so I should definitely be able to see the color on myself. This is absolutely useless to me.

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: great little duo, but if you have mature skin...
review_content:
This is a great little duo with a couple of caveats. The Nars bronzer is my all time favorite - It is very natural with just a tad of shimmer, blends easily, and is perfect for day or evening wear. That is not the case with the orgasm blush. It is a beautiful color blush, but it does have quite a bit of shimmer and sparkle. That shimmer/sparkle looks lovely for evening/night wear. However, for day wear, (under sunlight, offie light, etc.) I need to use the blush quite sparingly. Otherwise, on my mature skin, the shimmer/sparkle of the blush looks unnatural, artificial and unflattering. The second issue is that it is hard to pick up just the bronzer with my designated bronzer brush without getting some blush on it as well. That is frustrating as I I like to use the blush just high on my cheek bones. I am sure there are other smaller bronzer brushes that would fix that problem.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Type Dry', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_title: Not great for the high price
review_content: I really like Nars products a lot. I do like the blush in here. The shimmers in it make it not useful for everyday use. It has a nice pigment though. The bronzer is nice, but not as pigmented.

So after hearing everyone and their mom rave about both of these shades, I had to hop on board and try it. I purchased the mini, because $50 on a single blush/bronzer isn't something I can do. I was so so so excited to try these when they came in the mail. Orgasm is a nice shade, but I don't care for the sparkles in it. Laguna on the other hand, was the biggest let down. There is not pigmentation to this. My brush won't pick anything up! Even when I swatch it with my finger, I get nothing. I tried using my fix plus spray on the brush, still nothing. So I basically paid $30 plus tax for a single mini blush. Not impressed

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Blue']
review_content:
Got travel size Summer 2013. Didn't hit pan until Fall 2016. This was the only blush/bronzer I used that whole time. I'm very fair so I didn't need much product. Could build and blend both colors easily. I applied each color with large angled contour brush. Recommend saving protective plastic cover and cutting it in half. Then placing it over the color your not using so you only pick up one color at a time. Really love this blush/bronzer duo! Will repurchase! Would highly recommend!

I absolutely love this compact! It's super cute and great for travel. The only thing is that the first few uses it's a little difficult to pick up the product but after the first couple of uses the product picks up seamlessly!

Poor quality. The orgasm color was good and pigmented but too shimmery for me. The bronzer was of poor quality. Despite many attempts to lift color off it, barely anything came off. Disappointing purchase. Would not recommend to anyone
I've bought this product for years and have never been disappointed. Great color combo.
